DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study measure percentage woman know Coronary Artery Disease ( CAD ) hyporesponsive low dose ( 81 mg ) aspirin .
DOC.brief_title: Aspirin Responsiveness Women With Coronary Artery Disease
DOC.criteria: Able willing provide inform consent Women least 45 year old race Taking 81 mg aspirin daily , least one month Diagnosed know suspected CAD least one following : angiographic evidence least one lesion > 50 % stenosis , history significant elevation biomarker troponin CKMB , history ECG change least 2 contiguous lead characterize either new ST depression > 0.1 mV transient ( < 30 min ) ST elevation > 0.1 mV , coronary artery revascularization either PCI CABG < 45 year > 85 year age Clinically unstable : hypotension define sustain systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg due cardiac failure associate symptom , unstable severe pulmonary edema , decompensated congestive heart failure , acute mitral regurgitation , acute ventricular septal defect , acute cerebrovascular event transient ischemic attack ( TIA ) within past six month , history ventricular fibrillation implantable cardioverter defibrillator ( ICD ) , sustain supraventricular tachycardia > 30 second associate symptom ICD , untreated complete heart block untreated high grade secondary heart block Pregnant , plan become pregnant , breastfeed Alcohol abuse illicit drug abuse Allergy intolerance salicylate and/or excipients include history and/or active GI bleed Use NSAIDs within seven day plan regular use study Taking HRT oral contraceptive within past 30 day plan use study Use heparin , warfarin , ADP inhibitor ( clopidogrel , prasugrel , ticlopidine ) , glycoprotein IIb/IIa inhibitor within previous 96 hour plan use study Use plan use medication know interfere AAinduced platelet function Currently participate another investigational drug device study Survival le six month
